main event: On the night of February 11, 1964, a civilian observed multiple white objects traveling in a tight formation over Brooklyn, New York.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 2-3 minutes., The observer described the objects as oval shaped and white, about three-quarters the size of the full moon., The objects moved in a straight line towards the Southeast without making any noise., A possibility of reflections or meteors was suggested in the report., The observer called the police immediately after the sighting.
witness description: a civilian walking home from a friend's house near a church
